00011 // FillRow functions: these start from the matrix qiqjs and calculates a matrix
00012 // that is the sums of qiqjs - the (i,j)th element is the sum of all qiqjs
00013 // in the box (i->n, j->n). In the interference calculation, these are the only
00014 // sums that are necessary to calculate.
00015 // There are many different ways of doing this, but here is an implementation 
00016 // that only evaluates 0.5*n(n+1) sums.
00017 
00018 // Plus: we need to calculate the same matrix, but with specific qi's set to zero
00019 // For a correlated medium (eg variable density), there are 2^n different permutations
00020 // For an uncorrelated geometry (fixed density), we don't need to calculate anything new
00021 // for each permutation - just keep the original, but set the last qi's to zero
00022 
00023 // _FillFirstRow: fills the (n-1)th row and column of sumqiqjs
00024 void _FillFirstRow( unsigned long n, unsigned long z, std::vector<bool> zeroed,
00025                                                 array2D& qiqjs, array3D& sumqiqjs )
00026 {
00027   // If the (n-1)th row is zeroed, jump ahead to the answer
00028   if (zeroed[n-1])
00029   {
00030     for (unsigned long i=0; i<n; ++i)
00031     {
00032       sumqiqjs[z][n-1][i] = 0.; sumqiqjs[z][i][n-1] = 0.;
00033     }
00034   }
00035   else
00036   {
00037     // The bottom right hand corner of the matrix has just one contribution
00038     sumqiqjs[z][n-1][n-1] = qiqjs[n-1][n-1];
00039 
00040     // Now fill in the lower row and the right most column
00041     for (unsigned long i=2; i<(n+1); ++i)
00042     {
00043       sumqiqjs[z][n-1][n-i] = sumqiqjs[z][n-1][n-i+1] + (!zeroed[n-i])*qiqjs[n-1][n-i];
00044       sumqiqjs[z][n-i][n-1] = sumqiqjs[z][n-1][n-i];
00045     }
00046   }
00047 }
00048 
00049 // _FillNextRow - having done the summations for the bottom row and the right column,
00050 // spread out the results to the next row and column
00051 void _FillNextRow( unsigned long n, unsigned long i, 
00052         unsigned long z, std::vector<bool> zeroed, array2D& qiqjs, array3D& sumqiqjs )
00053 {
00054   for (unsigned long j=0; j<(i+1); ++j)
00055     sumqiqjs[z][i][i-j] = sumqiqjs[z][i+1][i-j] 
00056         + sumqiqjs[z][i][i-j+1] - sumqiqjs[z][i+1][i-j+1] 
00057         + (!zeroed[i])*(!zeroed[i-j])*qiqjs[i][i-j];
00058 
00059   for (unsigned long j=1; j<(i+1); ++j)
00060     sumqiqjs[z][i-j][i] = sumqiqjs[z][i][i-j];
00061 }
00062 
00063 // _FillAllRows - driving function for FillFirstRow and FillNextRow
00064 // We could probably do this by a recursive function that calls itself, but
00065 // let's do it the simple way.
00066 void _FillAllRows2DSymmetric( unsigned long n, array2D& qiqjs, array3D& sumqiqjs, long z )
00067 {
00068   std::vector<bool> zeroed( n );
00069   _NumberToBoolArray( z, zeroed, n ); 
00070   _FillFirstRow( n, z, zeroed, qiqjs, sumqiqjs );
00071   for (unsigned long i=2; i<(n+1); ++i)
00072     _FillNextRow( n, n-i, z, zeroed, qiqjs, sumqiqjs );
00073 }
00074 
00075 void _FillAllRows1D( unsigned long n, array1D& khatqis, array2D& sumkhatqis, long z )
00076 {
00077   // We will be stepping through setting each qi to zero
00078   // Create a vector of bools to indicate which qi is zero for this iteration
00079   std::vector<bool> zeroed( n );
00080 
00081   // Convert number z to an array of bools, the ith element saying whether qi should be zero
00082   _NumberToBoolArray( z, zeroed, n ); 
00083   // Starting point for the iteration: (n-1)th has just one element, khat.q_{n-1}
00084   sumkhatqis[z][n-1] = (!zeroed[n-1])*khatqis[n-1];
00085   // Now iterate over the rest, adding one khatqi at each step
00086   for (unsigned long i=2; i<(n+1); ++i)
00087     sumkhatqis[z][n-i] = sumkhatqis[z][n-i+1] + (!zeroed[n-i])*khatqis[n-i];
00088 }
00089 
00090 void _Fill2DFrom1D( unsigned long n, array2D& sumkhatqi_iton, 
00091                         array3D& sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton, long z )
00092 {
00093   for (unsigned long i=0; i<n; ++i)
00094   {
00095     for (unsigned long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00096     {
00097       sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i] + sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00098     }
00099     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][n] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i];
00100   }
00101   for (unsigned long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00102   {
00103     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00104   }
00105   sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][n] = 0.;
00106 }
00107 
00108 // _DotProducts2D: want qi.qj. Take n vectors, expressed in polar coords
00109 // ( magnitudes mags, polar vectors ths ), and fill the 2 dimension nxn matrix
00110 // res with the results qi.qj
00111 void _DotProducts2D( unsigned long n, MyArray& mags, MyArray& ths, array2D& res )
00112 {
00113   // TODO: put in asserts to check that the dimensions of mags, ths and res are correct
00114 
00115   // The operations sin and cos are numerically expensive
00116   // For the dot products: will need cos( ths[i] - ths[j] )
00117   // = cos(ths[i]) cos(ths[j]) + sin(ths[i]) sin(ths[j])
00118   // Here: evaluate them 2n times, instead of possibly n^2 or 0.5*n(n+1)
00119   MyArray sines(n), cosines(n);
00120   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00121   {
00122     sines[i] = sin( ths[i] );
00123     cosines[i] = cos( ths[i] );
00124   }
00125 
00126   // Now, find the 2D matrix qi.qj
00127   // We know that it is symmetric, so first we'll evaluate the off-diagonal on
00128   // one side, then mirror it over to the other side
00129   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00130     for (unsigned long j=i+1; j!=n; ++j)
00131     {
00132       res[i][j] = mags[i] * mags[j] * ( cosines[i]*cosines[j] + sines[i]*sines[j] );
00133       res[j][i] = res[i][j];
00134     }
00135 
00136   // Now all that's left is the diagonal
00137   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00138     res[i][i] = mags[i] * mags[i];
00139 
00140   // And we're done!
00141 }
00142 
00143 
00144 // _DotProducts1D: want k.qi. Take n vectors, expressed in polar coords
00145 // ( magnitudes mags, polar vectors ths ) and dot into one fixed vector (mag1, th1),
00146 // to give the 1 dimensional array res
00147 void _DotProducts1D( unsigned long n, double mag1, double th1, 
00148                         MyArray& mags, MyArray& ths, array1D& res )
00149 {
00150   // TODO: put in asserts to check that the dimensions of mags, ths and res are correct
00151 
00152   // No need to pre-calculate the cosine this time, we'll just jump in
00153   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00154     res[i] = mag1 * mags[i] * cos( th1 - ths[i] );
00155 
00156   // And we're done!
00157 }
00158 
00159 
00160 }

00163 QperpCalculator::QperpCalculator( unsigned long n_, bool correlated_ )
00164   : n(n_), correlated(correlated_), 
00165     qs( n_ ), ths( n_ ),
00166     qiqj( boost::extents[n_][n_] ),
00167     thk(pi),
00168     khatqi( boost::extents[n_] )
00169 {
00170   twotothen = power(2,n);
00171 
00172   if ( correlated==0 )
00173   {
00174     sumqiqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[1][n+1][n+1] );
00175     sumkhatqi_iton.resize( boost::extents[1][n] );
00176     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[1][n+1][n+1] );
00177     sumkqikqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[1][n+1][n+1] );
00178   }
00179   else
00180   {
00181     sumqiqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[twotothen][n+1][n+1] );
00182     sumkhatqi_iton.resize( boost::extents[twotothen][n] );
00183     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[twotothen][n+1][n+1] );
00184     sumkqikqj_itonjton.resize( boost::extents[twotothen][n+1][n+1] );
00185   }
00186 }

00204 double QperpCalculator::GetSumQiQj( unsigned long i_, unsigned long j_, unsigned long z_ ) const
00205 {
00206   long i = i_-1; long j = j_-1; long z = z_;
00207 
00208   if ( !correlated )
00209   {
00210     if (i < z) i = z_;
00211     if (j < z) j = z_;
00212     z = 0;
00213   }
00214 
00215   boost::array<array3D::index,3> idx = {{z,i,j}};
00216   return ( sumqiqj_itonjton( idx ) + sumkqikqj_itonjton( idx ) );
00217 }

00219 void QperpCalculator::SetK( double k_ )
00220 {
00221   k = k_; double k2 = k*k;
00222 
00223   long zmax;
00224   correlated ? zmax = twotothen-1 : zmax = 0;
00225   
00226   for( index3D z=0; z<=zmax; ++z )
00227   {
00228     for ( index3D i=0; i<n+1; ++i )
00229     {
00230       for ( index3D j=0; j<n+1; ++j )
00231       {
00232         sumkqikqj_itonjton[z][i][j] = sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][j] * k + k2;
00233       }
00234     }
00235   }
00236 }

00238 void QperpCalculator::SetQperps( MyArray& qs_, MyArray& ths_ )
00239 {
00240   qs = qs_;
00241   ths = ths_;
00242 
00243   CalcQmatrices2();
00244 }
00245 
00246 // CalcQmatrices2: once we have received a set of q vectors, calculate all the qiqjs
00247 // and sumqiqjs, as well as khatqis and sumkhatqis
00248 void QperpCalculator::CalcQmatrices2()
00249 {
00250   // Here, we pre-calculate all the necessary qi.qj elements and their useful sums
00251   // We'll also calculate the angular part of k.qi, but we'll keep the magnitude of k
00252   // generic at the moment. This way, we can iterate over all possible k magnitudes
00253   // for one set of qi.qj's.
00254 
00255   // First, calculate all qi.qj elements. This fills 2D matrix qiqj with qi.qj 
00256   _DotProducts2D( n, qs, ths, qiqj );
00257   // Now calculate k.qi elements for unit vector k. This fills khatqi.
00258   _DotProducts1D( n, 1., thk, qs, ths, khatqi );
00259 
00260   // Will iterate over all sets of zeroed out q's, if we have a correlated medium
00261   long zmax;
00262   correlated ? zmax = twotothen-1 : zmax = 0;
00263 
00264   for (long z=0; z<=zmax; ++z)
00265   {
00266     // Now we want to fill the 2D matrix sumqiqj_itonjton.
00267     _FillAllRows2DSymmetric( n, qiqj, sumqiqj_itonjton, z );
00268     // Finally, filling sumkhatqi_iton matrix
00269     _FillAllRows1D( n, khatqi, sumkhatqi_iton, z );
00270     // Convert the 1D khatqi_iton into a 2D khatqikhatqj ready for adding to qiqj_itonjton
00271     _Fill2DFrom1D( n, sumkhatqi_iton, sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton, z );
00272   }
00273 }

00280 void _OuterProduct1D1D( unsigned long n, MyArray& mags1, MyArray& ths1, MyArray& mags2, MyArray& ths2, array2D& res )
00281 {
00282   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00283     for (unsigned long j=i+1; j!=n; ++j)
00284     {
00285       res[i][j] = mags1[i] * mags2[j] * cos( ths1[i] - ths2[j] );
00286       res[j][i] = res[i][j];
00287     }
00288   
00289   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00290     res[i][i] = mags1[i] * mags2[i];
00291 }
00292 
00293 void _OuterProduct0D1D( unsigned long n, double mag1, double th1, MyArray& mags2, MyArray& ths2, array1D& res )
00294 {
00295   for (unsigned long i=0; i!=n; ++i)
00296     res[i] = mag1 * mags2[i] * cos( th1 - ths2[i] );
00297 }

00300 
00301 void _Iterate2DForZeroes( unsigned long n, array2D& qiqjs, array3D& sumqiqjs )
00302 {
00303   // Now we go through all the possible combinations of zeroed columns and rows
00304   std::vector<bool> zeroed( n );
00305   double tmp;
00306   for (unsigned long z=1; z<pow(2,n); ++z)
00307   {
00308     // First, calculate the array of zeroed bools
00309     _NumberToBoolArray( z, zeroed, n );
00310     // Now, iterated over all the elements
00311     for (unsigned long i=0; i<n; ++i) 
00312     { 
00313       for (unsigned long j=0; j<n; ++j) 
00314       {
00315         // If either the row or column has been zeroed, subtract off from answer
00316         tmp = sumqiqjs[0][i][j];
00317         for (unsigned long ii=i; ii<n; ii++)
00318         {
00319           for (unsigned long jj=j; jj<n; jj++)
00320           {
00321             if ( zeroed[ii] || zeroed[jj] )
00322               tmp -= qiqjs[ii][jj];
00323           }
00324         }
00325         sumqiqjs[z][i][j] = tmp;
00326       }
00327     }
00328   }
00329 }
00330 
00331 void _Iterate1DForZeroes( unsigned long n, array1D& khatqis, array2D& sumkhatqis )
00332 {
00333   std::vector<bool> zeroed(n);
00334   double tmp;
00335   for (unsigned long z=1; z<pow(2,n); ++z)
00336   {
00337     // First, calculate the array of zeroed bools
00338     _NumberToBoolArray( z, zeroed, n );
00339     // Now, iterated over all the elements
00340     for (unsigned long i=0; i<n; ++i) 
00341     { 
00342       // Now deal with k part
00343       tmp = sumkhatqis[0][i];
00344       for (unsigned long ii=i; ii<n; ++ii)
00345       {
00346         if ( zeroed[ii] )
00347         {
00348           tmp -= khatqis[ii];
00349         }
00350       }
00351       sumkhatqis[z][i] = tmp;
00352     }
00353   }
00354 }

00357 
00358 void QperpCalculator::CalcQmatrices()
00359 {
00360   // Array of q_i.q_j summed from i to n
00361   array2D sumqiqj_iton;
00362   // Array of q_i.q_j summed from j to n
00363   array2D sumqiqj_jton;
00364 
00365   sumqiqj_iton.resize( boost::extents[n][n] );
00366   sumqiqj_jton.resize( boost::extents[n][n] );
00367 
00368   // Here, we pre-calculate all the necessary qi.qj elements and their useful sums
00369 
00370   // First, calculate all qi.qj elements and khat.qi
00371   _OuterProduct1D1D( n, qs, ths, qs, ths, qiqj );
00372   _OuterProduct0D1D( n, 1., thk, qs, ths, khatqi );
00373   
00374   // Now, calculate sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = Sum[ qiqj[i][jj], {jj, j, n} ];
00375   // ie sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_iton[i][j+1] + qiqj[i][j]
00376   // sumqiqj_iton[i][j] = transpose sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_jton[j][i]
00377   for (index2D i=0; i!=n; ++i) 
00378   {
00379     sumqiqj_jton[i][n-1] = qiqj[i][n-1];
00380     sumqiqj_iton[n-1][i] = sumqiqj_jton[i][n-1];
00381     for (index2D j=(n-2); j>=0; --j)
00382     {
00383       sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_jton[i][j+1] + qiqj[i][j];
00384       sumqiqj_iton[j][i] = sumqiqj_jton[i][j];
00385     }
00386   }
00387   
00388   // Now we calculate the final product
00389   
00390   // sumqiqj_itonjton[i][j] = Sum[ sumqiq_jton[ii][j], {ii, i, n} ];
00391   // ie sumqiqj_itonjton[i][j] = sumqiqj_itonjton[i+1][j] + sumqiqj_jton[i][j]
00392   sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n][n] = 0.;
00393   for (long j=0; j<n; ++j) 
00394   {
00395     sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n][j] = 0.;
00396     sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n-1][j] = sumqiqj_jton[n-1][j];
00397     for (long i=(n-2); i>=0; --i)
00398     {
00399       sumqiqj_itonjton[0][i][j] = sumqiqj_itonjton[0][i+1][j] + sumqiqj_jton[i][j];
00400     }
00401   }
00402   
00403   // Now throw in sumkhatqi_iton[i] = Sum[ khatqi[ii], {ii,i,n} ];
00404   // ie sumkhatqi_iton[i] = sumkhatqi_iton[i+1] + khatqi[i]
00405   sumkhatqi_iton[0][n-1] = khatqi[n-1];
00406   for (long i=(n-2); i>=0; --i)
00407   {
00408     sumkhatqi_iton[0][i] = sumkhatqi_iton[0][i+1] + khatqi[i];
00409   }
00410 
00411   if ( correlated )
00412   {
00413     // Now we go through all the possible combinations of zeroed columns and rows
00414     _Iterate2DForZeroes( n, qiqj, sumqiqj_itonjton );
00415     _Iterate1DForZeroes( n, khatqi, sumkhatqi_iton );
00416   }
00417 
00418   // Now calc sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton
00419   long zmax; correlated ? zmax = twotothen-1 : zmax = 0;
00420   for (long z=0; z<=zmax; ++z)
00421   {
00422     for (long i=0; i<n; ++i)
00423     {
00424       for (long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00425       {
00426         sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i] + sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00427       }
00428       sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][n] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i];
00429     }
00430     for (long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00431     {
00432       sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00433     }
00434     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][n] = 0.;
00435   }
00436 }
